rules.name: Germanic Specific Lexical Changes
rule: h > * / #su_nus# ;; Apparently due to Dybo's law
* > i, $ / #dwoh_#, #dwo_hi# ;; Germanic added the plural suffix /-i/
;; germanic used the neuter kwet'wo:r. also irregular change kw > p due to penkwe (five)
w > s / #_eks# ;; Same story as with petwor, /s/ from septM
;; This was technically a later change (post grimms law), but for simplicity I'm doing it here
;; dekmt from the collective form, while seven and nine from analogy with dekmt
rules.description:
You can ignore this rule block. 

It just performs some grammatical changes from dictionary P.I.E. that occur on these words within the Germanic branch.

rules.name: S-Insertion
rules.description: /s/ is inserted to brake up clusters of coronal plosives i.e. tt > tst

rules.name: Laryngeal colouring
rules.description:
Assuming h₁ = h, h₂ = x, h₃ = ɣʷ

/xe/ > /xa/ — *h₂énti > *h₂ánti
/ex/ > /ax/ — *meh₂tḗr > *mah₂tḗr
/ɣʷe/ > /ɣʷo/ — *h₃érō  > *h₃órō
/eɣʷ/ > /oɣʷ/ — *bʰléh₃mō  > *bʰlóh₃mō

rules.name: Centumisation
rule: P:[-fr, +bk, -hi, -lo] > [+hi] ;; q, ɢ, ɢʱ > k, ɡ, ɡʱ
rules.description: This list of sound changes assumes uvular theory and therefore Centumisation is a merger of uvular consonants to velar. I.e. kápros 'goat' (pronounced ˈqa.pros) > ˈka.pros

rules.name: U-Epenthesis
rules.description: Syllabic sonorants become non-syllabic and are preceded by /u/ (i.e. *km̥tóm > *kumtóm)

rules.name: Dental Cluster Simplification
rules.description: tst > ss (i.e. *káydstis > *káyssis)

rules.name: Long Vowel Degemination
rules.description:
Geminate consonants are shortened after a consonant or a long vowel
i.e. *káyssis > *káysis

rules.name: Overlong Vowel Genesis
rules.description:
Word-final long vowels are lengthened to overlong vowels
i.e. *séh₁mō > *séh₁mô

rules.name: Initial Loss of laryngeals
rule: {h, x, ɣʷ} > * / V_                         ;; Lost after vowels with comp. lenghtening above
V:[+hi] > G:[-tense] / V_$                  ;; u, i > w, j after vowels in the same syll.
rules.description: Lost of laryngeals word-initially and after vowels, with compensatory lengthening

rules.name: Cowgill's Law
rules.description: h₃ /ɣʷ/ and h₂ /x/ are strengthened to /g/ between a sonorant and /w/

rules.name: Laryngeal Vocalisation
rules.description: Syllabic laryngeals become schwa. Remaining laryngeals delete

rules.name: Velar Labialisation
rule: w > * / C:[+hi, +bk, +rnd]_  ;; /w/ deletes when after Pʷ
;; This could be written in one as:
rules.description: Velars are merge and labialise with following /w/

rules.name: Velar Delabialisation (Boukólos rule)
rules.description: Labiovelars are delabialised next to /u/ (or /un/) or before /t/:

rules.name: Irregular Labial Assimilation
rules.description: i.e. penkwe > pempe, wlkwos > wulfaz

rules.name: Loss of Word-final non-high short vowels
rule: ;; The above moves stress onto the previous syllable if the word-final vowel is stressed
rules.description:
Short /a/, /e/, /o/, and any preceding glide, is lost.

i.e. wóyde, tósyo, unswé => *wóyd, tós, úns

rules.name: Grimm's Law
rules.description:
Chain shift of the three series of plosives.
Voiceless plosives become fricatives
Voiced plosives are devoiced
Aspirated plosives become voiced plosives or fricatives.

rules.name: Verner's Law
rules.description:
Voiceless fricatives are voiced when preceded by an unaccented vowel.
Including cases where the vowel and fricative are separated by a sonorant.

rules.name: Initial Stress Shift
rule: % > [+str] / #_ (..) %:[+str] ;; If there is a stressed syll, the initial syll is stressed
%:[+str] > [-str] | #_        ;; Any non-initial stressed syll is unstressed
rules.description: Preserves unstressed words

rules.name: W-Loss
rules.description: /w/ is lost between /o/ and /o/, results in long vowel /o:/

rules.name: ew > ow
rules.description: Unstressed /ew/ > /ow/ before a consonant or word-finally i.e. *-ews > *-owz

rules.name: E-Raising
rules.description:
Unstressed /e/ > /i/ except before /r/ i.e. *-eþā > *-iþā
Any unstressed /ej/ becomes /i:/

rules.name: Unstressed ji > i
rules.description: Unstressed /ji/ > /i/ i.e. *legyidi > *ligiþi

rules.name: Non-High Back Vowel Merger
rules.description: Merging of /o/ and /a/ into /ɑ/ i.e. *kápros > *hafraz

rules.name: Nasal Merger
rules.description: /m/ > /n/ word finally or before dental consonants i.e. *ḱm̥tóm > *hundan

rules.name: Word-final Nasalisation
rules.description:
Word-final /n/ is lost after unstressed syllables, and the preceding vowel is nasalised 
i.e. *hundan > *hundą

rules.name: Nasal Vowel Lowering
rule: e:[+nasal, Along, Bvlong] > ɑ:[+nasal, Along, Bvlong]
rules.description: /ẽː/ is lowered to /ɑ̃ː/ i.e. *dedę̄ > *dedą̄

rules.name: Schwa Elimination
rules.description:
Unstressed schwa deletes
Stressed schwa becomes ɑ

rules.name: Loss of word-final t
rules.description: i.e. *tehunt > *tehun

rules.name: ɣʷ > w
rules.description: i.e. *snaygʷaz > *snaiwaz, *hʷegʷlā > *hʷewlā

rules.name: Long-A Raising
rules.description: i.e. *sēmâ > *sēmô

rules.name: Early i-mutation
rules.description:
/e/ > /i/ when followed by /i/ or /j/ in the same or next syllable
Any /ej/ becomes /i:/

rules.name: Nasal Raising
rules.description: /e/ > /i/ when followed by a syllable-final nasal

rules.name: Loss of intervocalic /j/
rules.description: /j/ is lost between vowels except after /i/ and /w/

rules.name: Nasal Fricative Cluster Simplification
rules.description:
/n/ is lost before /x/, causing compensatory lengthening and nasalisation of the preceding vowel 
i.e. *ḱónketi > *hanhidi [ˈxɑ̃ːxiði]

rules.name: Diphthong Representation
rules.description:
Uncomment to optionally make all vowel/glide sequences vowel/non-syllabic-vowel 
i.e. ew > eu̯

into: kʷ, gʷ, gʷʱ > kʷ, gʷ, gʷʱ
k, g, gʱ > q, ɢ, ɢʱ
ḱ, ǵ, ǵʱ > k, g, gʱ
h₁, h₂, h₃ > h, x, ɣʷ
